content.description: Follow the obvious "Z" crack.  Another rarely done route.  The rock quality off the main ledge on the top of the main Negress isn't so great.
content.location: Rightmost route on the Raven Ledge.

content.description: This is the striking/obvious left facing major dihedral.  Face climbing leads past a few bolts to the dihedral.  Stem and face climb the dihedral to a bulge where the crux boulder problem is encountered.  Mostly straight forward except for the tricky, and potentially heartbreaking, boulder problem right at the end.
content.location: Leftmost route on the ledge, or, first route encountered when approaching from the via feratta.

climbs.name: The Old Man and the Seam
climbs.fa: Darrell Hensel, Rick Ziegler, Jeff Scheuerell, Marty Lewis, 1/2018

content.description: This line obtains and climbs the arete that is the outside right edge of the Procrastinator dihedral.  Face climb up and slightly left to obtain the old aid seam, follow the seam for a few bolts, then move left onto the arete.  Continue with the arete/seam to it's end.
content.location: Starts on the second level/tier of the ledge system.  Right of The Procrastinator and immediately left of Better Late Than Never.

content.description: A fun sport climb that sits high above the rest of the gorge. Worth it just for the position, but also has some great climbing. Belay at a two bolt anchor, then move up and right into cracks and interesting angled features. After a cruxy move, a lower angle dihedral is followed to a small stance. Tightly bolted slab above leads to mussy hooks.
content.protection: Bolts.  12 or so get you the mussy hooks.
content.location: This route is about 40 feet right of The Procrastinator, which is the large, left facing dihedral sitting high above the left side of the Negress Wall.  To approach, hike up the central gorge trail until about even with dihedral.  Exposed class 3 scrambling leads to the base of the Procrastinator and then Better Late.

content.description: Obvious crack line.  Rarely done, it would be reasonable to expect, shall we say, encountering some choss.
content.protection: Gear to 2", gear anchor, walk off left.
content.location: From Better Late Than Never continue rightwards (careful 3rd) across the exposed ledge to a crack on the left end of the very large and flat ledge that is the top of the main Negress Wall.
